The album took seven months to make, and [apart from 
Carlos Santana himself] involved a completely different 
line-up from Santana's previous album [released two and 
a half years earlier]. It was firmly in the style of the 
1980s, making much use of synthesizers and drum machines. 
Beyond Appearances performed relatively poorly, reaching 
only fifty on the Billboard album chart; one of its tracks
"Say It Again", reached number 46 on the Billboard Hot 100 
singles chart [though it performed better on Billboard's 
Mainstream Rock Tracks chart, reaching number 15].
